thread.title: Operation Barbarossa: Unseen Second World War photographs by Field Marshal Wolfram von Richthofen
thread.title_full: Operation Barbarossa: Unseen Second World War photographs by Field Marshal Wolfram von Richthofen

title: Operation Barbarossa: Unseen Second World War photographs by Field Marshal Wolfram von Richthofen
text:
Previous slide Next slide 1 of 14 View All Skip Ad 
Photo albums belonging to Field Marshal Wolfram von Richthofen, cousin of the infamous First World War fighter pilot the Red Baron, are being put up for auction at Dickins with a Â£20,000 estimate. The images give an insight into his military career in the Third Reich. 
The two albums were taken from Berlin by a British soldier at the end of the Second World War who kept it for sixty years before they were passed into the hands of a private collector. 
Operation Barbarossa was the name given to Nazi Germany's invasion of Russia on 22nd June 1941. 
Click through to see the dramatic images. 
Ricthofen with Hitler at the huge Nazi victory parade for the Condor Legion in the heart of Berlin in June 1939. Dickins / BNPS
